titleStmt.title: (A key to the colourization may be found at: http://oracc.museum.upenn.edu/doc/user/teicolours.html.)X300854 = AD -085C₂

w.lemma: emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V
emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V

p.span: [...] the cold became severe. Night of the 2nd, the m[oon ...]
[... the cold] became severe. Night of the 3rd (and) the 3rd, the cold became severe. Night of the 4th, beg[inning? of the night, ...]
[... Night] of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 cubits below ζ Tauri ... [...]
[...] night, clouds crossed the sky, rain DUL. The 7th, all day clouds crossed the sky [...]
[... Night of the 9th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 2 1/2 cubits [behind β Geminorum], the moon being 3 cubits low to the south; first part of the night, Mars was [...] below [η Piscium ...]
[... Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, the moon was x]+1/2 cubits [in front of α Leonis], 6 fingers below Saturn, it stood 2 1/2 cubits in front of Jupiter to the west [...]
[... Night of the 13th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 2 1/2 cubits in front of β Virginis, the moon being 1 cubit high to the north ... [...]
[...] clouds crossed the sky, lightning flashed, slow thunder, rain DUL, the north wind blew. Night of the 10+[xth, ...]
[... Night of the 15th, last part of the night, the moon was] 2 1/2 cubits [above] α Virginis, the moon having passed a little to the east. The 15th, the north wind blew. Night of the 16th, [...]
[... Night of the 18th, first part of the night, Venus was] 1 cubit below η Tauri; last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of α Scorpii, the moon being 4 cubits high to the north [...]
[...] being 1/2 cubit back to the west. Night of the 20th, all night clouds crossed the sky, rain PISAN DIB. The 20th, all [day ...]

[... Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the moon was ... in front of β Capricorni], the moon being 1 1/2 cubits low to the south. Around the 22nd, Mercury’s last appearance in the east in Pisces; clouds, I did not [watch ...]
[...] ... Night of the 25th (and) the 25th, the north wind blew. The 26th, moonrise to sunrise: 14°, measured (despite) mist. Ni[ght ...]
[...] ... Night of the 28th, all night clouds crossed the sky, lightning flashed, it thundered once [...]
[...] when Jupiter became stationary to the west, [it became stationary] 2/3 cubit in front of α Leonis, being 6 fingers high to the north [...]
[... fr]om the 1st to the 6th, 1 pānu 5 sūtu 1 1/2 qa; the 7th, 8th, (and) 9th, 1 pānu 5 i{sūtu}; from [the 10th to ...]
[...]pānu 4 1/2 qa; from the 8th to the 15th, 1 pānu 1 i{sūtu} 4 qa; fr[om the 16th to ...]
[... At] that time, Jupiter and Saturn were in Leo; Venus was in [...]
[...] around the 27th, Mars [last appearance] in Aries [...]
[...] last part of the night, the moon was 3+[x cubi]ts below ε Leonis, the moon having passed a little to the east [...]
